ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.ADDRESS: Borough of Telford & Wrekin, Addenbrooke House, Ironmasters Way

TITLE.P: Telford and Wrekin Fleet Services Vehicle Maintenance

SHORT_DESCR.P: Telford and Wrekin Council is seeking to potentially enter into a procurement for vehicle servicing, maintenance and MOTs for the Council's Fleet commencing 1.4.2019. The scope will likely consist of Servicing, maintenance and repairs (including tail lift inspections), MOTs, breakdown recovery, accident repair, vehicle glass supply and fitting, vehicle tyre supply and fitting, and compliancy checks as part of the Taxi licencing service. The Council therefore respectfully requests interested organisations to complete a market testing questionnaire which will assist the Council in shaping the structure of the future contract that is mutually beneficial to both the supplier and council. Organisations are requested to complete and submit a questionnaire by 12:00 GMT, 9.5.2018, available at www.delta-esourcing.com

Telford and Wrekin's fleet consists of 78 vehicles, a mix of 15/16 seater buses, and vans/cars. Further information on the makeup of the fleet is within the Questionnaire document. The new service will commence on 1.4.2019, and the scope of the service will likely consist of Servicing, maintenance and repairs (including tail lift inspections), MOTs, breakdown recovery, accident repair, vehicle glass supply and fitting, vehicle tyre supply and fitting, and compliancy checks as part of the Taxi licencing service.

INFO_ADD.P: Please note that this PIN is not a 'Call for Competition' and a separate Contract Notice will be published in due course in order to begin the procurement process, and as such, this PIN does not formally signify the beginning of a procurement process and does not constitute commitment to undertake a procurement exercise.
Please ensure you read the 'instructions for submission of questionnaire' for full instructions.

Documents are available on https://www.delta-esourcing.com Suppliers must register to respond or log in with your existing username and password, go to Response Manager and add the Tender Access Code R2MY3KX359 following any instructions provided.

Communication will only be accepted via ‘email the buyer’ in the tenderbox. Written replies will be provided to all enquiries and any points of clarification or information will be circulated to prospective suppliers via Delta.
If you experience any difficulties with the system at any please contact the Delta eSourcing Helpdesk on call 0845 270 7050 or email helpdesk@delta-esourcing.com
For more information about this opportunity, please visit the Delta eSourcing portal at:
